COME ON YOU SPURS




熱刺是一間座落英國倫敦北部托定咸區的職業足球會
從1882年成立至今已經擁有過百年歷史，現時競逐於英格蘭超級聯賽；
球會主場為白鹿徑球場，球會的拉丁文格言 ”Audere est Facere (To Dare Is To Do)” 則意謂「敢作敢為」








(部份圖片由淫心黃黃巴打提供)


榮耀：

甲組聯賽 冠軍：1950/1951、1960/1961
足總盃 冠軍：1900/1901、1920/1921、1960/1961、1961/1962、1966/1967、1980/1981、1981/1982、1990/1991
聯賽盃 冠軍：1970/1971、1972/1973、1998/1999、2007/2008
歐洲盃賽冠軍盃 冠軍：1962/1963
歐洲足協杯 冠軍：1971/1972、1983/1984

【打壓豪門】歐洲足協主席 倡議設薪金上限制度
歐洲足協主席施費連，表示足協方面正在認真考慮，為歐洲球會設立薪酬上限機制，以解決目前歐洲球會實力懸殊問題。

英意西法德5大聯賽在2016年收購球員的總開支達42億歐元（約365億港元），比2010年勁升56%，球員薪金支出數字亦水漲船高，施費連表示非常關注目前情況：「現時歐洲球會的現象是貧者越貧富者越富，財力差距越來越大。歐洲足協正在慎重考慮限制球會用在球員薪酬支出的可能性，引進薪金上限，可以令球會在收購球員上更加理性，要實行肯定是難關重重，但這亦是歷史性重要的一步。」

簽J.Potential同傷兵回歸

SpursNews
12分鐘 ·
Press Round Up. As always be sure to keep a pinch of salt handy as you read through.
-------------------------------------------------------
Spurs are favourites to sign Germany U21 midfielder Max Meyer with German press claiming the player is keen on the move to London and working with Pochettino. The fee is yet to be agreed with the German club holding on for more money and Spurs offer around the £15m mark.
(Sunday Mirror)
-------------------------------------------------------
Manchester Utd will increase their offer to £50m for Eric Dier in the hope Spurs will change their stance. In showing publicly how much they want the player they also hope he will force a move knowing he will more than double his wages at Old Trafford.
(The Sun on Sunday)
-------------------------------------------------------
Spurs continue to be favourites to land Ross Barkley however will not meet Evertons revised £30m asking price. The Evertonian midfielder is said to be keen on the move but would also consider a move to Manchester Utd who are said to be interested if they cannot land Eric Dier ironically from Tottenham.
(The Sun on Sunday)
-------------------------------------------------------
Spurs have opened talks with Real Madrid over the transfer of Mateo Kovacic according to reports in Spain. It is believed a deal can be done for in the region of £22m.
(The Sunday Star)
-------------------------------------------------------
Tottenham have made it clear to Manchester United and any other interested party that Eric Dier is not for sale at any price this window or any other window in the near future. Mauricio Pochettino rates the player highly and as such Spurs simply will not sell.
(The Mail on Sunday)
-------------------------------------------------------
Spurs are monitoring West Hams attempts to sign Javier Hernandez however are said to be content with current options at the moment.
(Sunday Express)
-------------------------------------------------------
Spurs are set to make their first signing of the summer with Pau Lopez finally expected to have his loan move turned into a permanent deal this week. A fee of £2.5m has finally been agreed by the two clubs.
(Marca)
-------------------------------------------------------
Spurs are set to sign young Argentinian defender Juan Foyth in the next week or so and are expected to agree to loan him back initially while they work out his work permit. A fee in the region of £8m has been agreed with the players club Estudiantes.
(ESPN)
-------------------------------------------------------
Moussa Sissoko has agreed to join PSG with the French club now to agree a fee with Spurs. Tottenham are looking to recoup as much of their outlay as possible on the midfield flop but accept they will likely have to take a hit. The Parisian clubs opening offer of £18m was rejected last week.
(Le Quipe)
-------------------------------------------------------
Kyle Walkers agent is becoming increasingly frustrating with Spurs who are refusing to negotiate over Kyle Walker. Spurs chairman Daniel Levy has made it clear that £50m is the price and if they want the player they will have to pay it, however Man City value him closer to £40m.
With their other right back option Dani Alves looking set for a move to Paris over Manchester Daniel Levy could even up his asking price.
(Sky Sports News)
-------------------------------------------------------
9th July 2017.

Tottenham on transfer alert over Real Madrid midfielder Mateo Kovacic
- FJ - Source: Standard Sport

Tottenham have been alerted to the availability of Mateo Kovacic, with Real Madrid prepared to sell the midfielder this summer.

Kovacic signed for Real Madrid from Inter Milan in 2015 on a six-year deal, joining up with his Croatian compatriot and "idol" Luka Modric at the Bernabeu.

However, Kovacic has struggled to command a regular starting role in Zinedine Zidane's squad, making 19 starts in La Liga last season and completing a full 90 minutes on just nine occasions.

Standard Sport understands that Champions League holders Madrid are considering selling Kovacic, with the 23-year-old midfielder currently being offered to clubs around Europe.

Spurs have been made aware that Kovacic is available, but his contract demands could prove to be a stumbling block given Spurs' rigid wage structure compared to their Premier League title rivals

​Any potential sale of Kovacic would hand Madrid valuable funds as they explore the possibility of making a world-record move for Monaco's Kylian Mbappe, who is also wanted by Arsenal.
